intro: Racosperma wickhamii, commonly known as Wickham's acacia, is a flowering plant native to Australia. It belongs to the Fabaceae family, which is characterized by its legume fruits and nitrogen-fixing abilities. The plant typically grows as a shrub or small tree, with compound leaves and yellow flowers that attract pollinators. It is well adapted to arid and semi-arid environments, showcasing resilience to drought and poor soil conditions. Its ecological role includes providing habitat and food for various native animals and insects.
